reviews.sentence: Great experience. Great service and experience but a bit pricey for my budget. Loved the room and wish we could have used the pool. Black swan was fun and enjoyed the evening. The breakfast was also pricey for the quality. We choose to eat elsewhere that had better quality with a better price. But overall we seriously enjoyed our stay at the Omni. Thank you.

Mokara spa is a must. Had a deep tissue massage and it was the best experience ever. Check in was a breeze locker room was beautiful and stocked well mineral bath and dry sauna were available spa showers are a must and the waiting room was perfect for relaxing. Appropriately priced for the quality of the service and atmosphere. Anie did a great job at working out the tension in my body. Professional staff and just an awesome experience. I liked having the mokara spa products for use in the locker room. I enjoyed getting to sample it. I will definitely be back in a month and have already recommended it to several of my friends.

First Class. I stayed one night on a business trip. The hotel is in the heart of the Galleria area of Houston. Nice surroundings and first class hotel. The front desk was efficient and acomdating to an unusual request I had regarding charging for parking. The breakfast was good with an attentive and cheerful waiter. I highly recommend this hotel.
Facilities good parking expensive and small.

Nice hotel but you pay for it. Hotel was clean with large rooms. Bell hop staff poor food and drinks are average and expensive and you have to pay for internet service. No vending machine or access to food and drinks after hours. If you want a bottle of water you have to drink tap water or buy it form the extremely over priced mini bar in your room.
Great location. Great location. Efficient and good price.

Experience with the Omni was great. Happy I got to enjoy the weekend with a happy experience. The hotel was very clean. When I arrived I was offered a upgrade with no extra charge. The staff was impeccable and the website pictures did no justice on how beautiful it was.

We were charged for things that we were told were free due to our Rewards Loyalty program upon Check In. We were given a Handicap Room without knowledge because they did nt have any Reg rooms available. They also nickel and dime you on lots of stuff but beds and decor was nice. Belhops and Valet personnel were professional.

Best Family Reunion. Awesome place to hold a Family Reunion. Great group rate price. Most family members if not all were on the same floor. Areas set up for each event were perfect from the Meet Greet which was off from the lobby to the polside picnic banquet in the Ballroom and finally room for Sunday Family Service. BRAVO Omni Hotel.

Satisfaction Guaranteed. We held our 40 year high school reunion at the Omni Galleria Hotel and resort in Houston and we were impressed with the rooms the pools amenities and restaurants. The service from the staff was first rate.

Good hotel unles you like towels and water. We are used to staying at Westin ’s and other Starwod propeties. The hotel is nice and the room is nice but for some reason they are stingy with towels and water. We had no water in the room and literally one towel for my wife and I to share. I had to call room service for a bottle of water at 3 am and it was 271. The next morning I needed just a glass of water to take aspirin and could not get in the lobby unles I pay another 271. I ’m actually not cheap and fine paying but it became a joke and I would rather leave then pay for water at this point. I told the valet about my experience half joking and he so he gave me two bottles of water. So if you need water go to the velvet at this hotel.

Just not what it once was and that is sad. Stayed there the middle of last month they had recently reopened. apx 30 days prior due to flooding from Hurricane Harvey. First thing first. as soon as I checked in the lady asked me if I had two reservations I promptly told her no just one for myself and did nt think much more about it. Well apparently she was either dense or they purposefully and intentionally ripped me off. I was never given a receipt for my stay which is usually slipped under the door sometime during the night now I know why. even though I told her I DID NOT HAVE TWO RESERVATIONS they still charged me anyway. Heres the real kicker they put me in just a standard room and the extra charge was for a premium room. LOL Well its been a month and after two promises to refund its still not been put back into my account. So now I have to go thru all the nonsense of disputing the charges because of the unscrupulously deceptive fake charge they did and lies to fix it that the Omni Houston did to one of their Platinum Members. I could go on and on and tell you about how substandard the remodel is and how loud the entry is now with nothing to deaden the sound I could tell you how the rooms are all still antiquated and were not upgraded I could mention the silly view master terrible art installation I could mention how theypol is no longer heated how there is no more lil shop for convenient items that you may need for the trip and it was replace by a wall of ridiculously over priced hand bags I could even tell you about them giving me a key to a room that someone was still staying in and I had to go back downstairs to resolve that I m glad the person staying there did nt kill me I wo nt even mention that they charge you 350 per night to self park your car in their enormous obtrusive parking garage that blocks the view of downtown. but I wo nt mention any of that. Just focus on them ripping me off with the double charge.

Rooms reserved through bokingcom were inferior to rooms previously stayed at this hotel. I had booked two king rooms at 250 per night during the week. I have stayed at Omni several times but this time I was given two handicapped accessible rooms. They had not been refinished had peeling wallpaper in bathrooms and no bathtubs. View was of garage. After complaining the rate was reduced to 179 per night but still a disappointing stay. Rooms were not remodeled wallpaper in bath peeling carpet old. Empty water bottle near bed when we checked in. After complaining the rate of room was reduced but that did not compensate for a stay in an unacceptable room.

Very nice hotel. I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The room was clean comfortable and quiet. I do think that the restaurants were overpriced for what was served and the service slow however the hotel was completely booked because of the large conferences that were in attendance at the time and perhaps that was why.

Comfortable beds. Excellent staff — extremely friendly and accommodating. The Birdie ’s Bar and Restaurant staff was very friendly and service was great. I enjoyed my burger and fries for lunch and a salad for dinner. The breakfast was not good to me —. the eggs and hahbrowns were too greasy. The food and beverage prices were slightly higher for the quality size than what I ’m used to and I travel frequently. Overall my experience was excellent. I would stay again. This was a business trip. I wish I could have enjoyed the beds and tv a bit more. I heard the fitness center was great even though I did n’t get to use it. Thanks again.

HUGE problems with billing. There were 60 of us staying at the hotel and almost everyones bill was incorrect. Some people were charged for a weeks worth of parking even though they did not have a car there. We were charged 75 per day up front for incidentals without being notified. I would never recommend the Omni to anyone.

I had skip this one. I will start by saying nothing terrible happened during my stay for business at The Omni but I felt a variety of small things added up to a lackluster experience. Location Not great. Definitely not walkable. It sits far from the main road on a long driveway so not entirely convenient. Because of this I ate on site. Food. I expect high food prices at hotels but what I do not agree with is extreme price gouging. I got a small iced coffee nothing fancy no espresso no cold brews and a fruit cup that was 19 and change with tax. I got smart for dinner and ordered Uber Eats. The Omni Valet was completely rude to my Uber Eats driver and the 60 seconds he was on their driveway. They then got a bit rude with me for having a delivery. There were no other cars on the driveway and my dropof took all of 60 seconds. The dropof impacted no one negatively except for Omni missing out on another meal charge from me. Due to lack of options I did a grab n go breakfast from Birdies the morning I was leaving. CAUTION. the yogurts were expired by several days and I told the staff member. She got defensive and said Yes I know. Oh okay. The room decor very outdated the shower looked like it was from 1989 no hair dryer in the room and no lights over the shower weird bar soap that left a slime on my skin. I always like to end reviews with would I stay here again. No. There are so many other hotels in Houston with great staff reasonable prices updated amenities decor and prime locations.
Hotel is nice and has good service. For the cost per night parking should be free.
Room confusion they still charge for wifi alot.

This hotel gets better and better. I have stated the Omni on and off for 20 Years and have always liked this particular location. I just returned after having not stayed there for 10 years and post flood and I have to say they have made it far better in the sense that the lobby is very inviting and beckons you to sit down and have a drink or a meeting. The rooms are just right and extremely good value. The beds are very comfortable and soft and the service is excellent. One differentiator of this hotel is that they offer you a complementary set of beverages in the morning and a bagel or English muffin as a nice wake up gesture. The bagels are not good quality and they do need to change find a new supplier but the fact they do this complementary is quite unique and very much appreciated. It is also smart because you become inclined to order some breakfast with it so I think it is also good for their bottom line revenue. The only negative on the hotel is the mediocre food in the all day dining Room. The Caesar salad have though taste. The Burger was served on a great brioche and was quite tasty but the attempt at the pho soup was not even close. The service despite my being the only person in the restaurant was spotty but Chatty and kind nonetheless. I offered some constructive critique at the Front desk and they cared enough to pass it on to the general manager which is very impressive in todays environment. The general manager wrote me a letter and took the macaroni and cheese off my bill which was not at all intended as I was happy to pay for it but she insisted. You just do not see this kind of management these days connected to all of the touch points in a hotel. The breakfast was great value but was lacking taste even other selection was perfect and I like the way they are trying to focus on just a few ingredients. The service in the bar was excellent I thought it was very smartly presented. I had recommend raising the price 20 and focusing on the quality of the ingredients. They have these fabulous biscuits and the only real sausage gravy in town all they need to do is add a little chicken stock and more pepper and they have a winner. The valet and bellmen are seamless which Is not always the case with concessions these days. In summary I thought the hotel was spectacular value and I credit the general manager with having put together a team that is genuinely motivated to make your stay more comfortable. Kudos.
